intro: Platytaenia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Platytaenia macrocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
